level.text: The governing instrument may provide for the creation by the statutory trust of one or more series with respect to specified property of the statutory trust if:

Records are maintained for the series which reasonably identify the property of the series, including by specific listing, category, type, quantity, or computational or allocational formula or procedure, such as a percentage or share of any property, or by any other method by which the identity of the property of the series is objectively determinable; and
Notice that the trust may have one or more series is set forth in the certificate of trust as required by ยง 29-1202.01(b)(4).
A series of a statutory trust shall not be an entity separate from the statutory trust.
A series of a statutory trust may have a separate purpose from the trust or any other series thereof if the purpose of the series is lawful and not a predominantly donative purpose.
